jobs.title: K-12 Chef
jobs.status: Full Time, 1 FTE (239 day calendar)Minimum Requirements:An Associate’s Degree or higher with a major course of study in the culinary arts or a related field.  A minimum of 3 years experience in the food service industry.  Institutional or school nutrition experience preferred.  Experience providing culinary training or coaching is preferred.Valid Food Handler's Permit/License is required.  Valid Driver's License is required.Must obtain a valid ServSafe permit/license within 6 months of being hired.  Must certify with the School Nutrition Association with Level 2 or 3 within 2 years of being hired.Must have current knowledge of culinary techniques, recipe development, food safety, and sanitation.  Must have an understanding of USDA child nutrition regulations and school food service operations.The salary for this position is assigned to lane 2 of the EC salary schedule.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkEC Salary Schedule.Attachment(s):K-12 Chef.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version
jobs.minimum_requirements: An Associate’s Degree or higher with a major course of study in the culinary arts or a related field.  A minimum of 3 years experience in the food service industry.  Institutional or school nutrition experience preferred.  Experience providing culinary training or coaching is preferred.Valid Food Handler's Permit/License is required.  Valid Driver's License is required.Must obtain a valid ServSafe permit/license within 6 months of being hired.  Must certify with the School Nutrition Association with Level 2 or 3 within 2 years of being hired.Must have current knowledge of culinary techniques, recipe development, food safety, and sanitation.  Must have an understanding of USDA child nutrition regulations and school food service operations.The salary for this position is assigned to lane 2 of the EC salary schedule.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkEC Salary Schedule.Attachment(s):K-12 Chef.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version

jobs.title: Substitute Bus Driver Trainee
jobs.status: On-Call/As NeededMinimum QualificationsMinimum age of 21 years.Have no more than 100 points recorded on past driving record.  No more than two at-fault accidents, two citations, or a combination of one at-fault accident and one citation, in a 24 month period.Hold and maintain a Utah Commercial Drivers License.  Driver Training will be provided if candidate needs to obtain the Utah Commercial Drivers License.The salary for this position is assigned to the BD Salary ScheduleAFTER completion of training.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkBD Salary Schedule.APPLICANTS ARE REQUIRED TO ATTACH/UPLOAD A COPY OF THEIR CURRENT DRIVING RECORD WITH THE APPLICATIONA copy of the driving record can be obtained from the Department of Motor Vehicles.Attachment(s):Bus Driver & Sub Bus Driver.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version

jobs.title: Head Girls Wrestling Coach (no teaching assignment)
jobs.description: This Head Girls Wrestling coaching assignment is for the 2025-2026 school year with no expectation of a teaching assignment.WCSD coaches are required to meet all UHSAA certification requirementspriorto starting assignment and are required to maintain certifications during duration of employment.If any additional questions, applicants can contact the Athletic Director, Jason Brooks,  at jason.brooks@washk12.org.A stipend will be provided for this assignment.

jobs.title: Head Baseball Coach (no teaching assignment)
jobs.description: This Head Baseball coaching assignment is for the 2025-2026 school year with no expectation of a teaching assignment.WCSD coaches are required to meet all UHSAA certification requirementspriorto starting assignment and are required to maintain certifications during duration of employment.If any additional questions, applicants can contact the Athletic Director, Dustin Drake, at dustin.drake@washk12.org.A stipend will be provided for this assignment.

jobs.title: Health and Safety Assistant
jobs.status: Part Time, 3 hours per weekMinimum Requirements:High school graduation or other equivalent, (i.e., GED, college, technical or trade school, foreign equivalency, etc.).  Experience working with children.  Medical experience or training and clerical experience preferred.Must hold and maintain the following certificates:*Current First Aid certificate from the American Heart Association, American Red Cross, or other similar organization.*Current Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR)/Automated External Defibrillator (AED)certification from the American Heart Association, American Red Cross, or other similar organization.Certifications must be maintained for the duration of the assignment. jobs.title: Substitute Bus Attendant
jobs.status: On-Call/As Needed BasisMinimum Requirements:High school diploma or general education degree (GED); or six months to one year related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.Ability to work effectively with individuals with disabilities.  Ability to learn tasks quickly and work with minimum supervision.  Ability to learn and implement emergency procedures associated with bus.  Previous experience working with individuals with disabilities preferred.The salary for this position is assigned to Level 2 of the SC Salary Schedule.To view the salary schedule, please select the following linkSC Salary Schedule.Attachment(s):Bus Attendant.pdfEmail To A FriendPrint Version
